711877f-a.title: Manhattan: 28th Street (East) - 3rd Avenue
711877f-a.text:
155-145 East 28th Street, north side, west of Third Avenue. In
the centre is St. Stenhen's Church (Roman Catholic), and to
the left its parochial school.
April 24, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

711876f-a.title: Manhattan: 28th Street (East) - 3rd Avenue
711876f-a.text:
208-214 E. 28th Street, south side, east of Third Avenue,
ahowing a children's playground (constructed and operated by the
W. P. A.) on a ste where abandoned builaings formerly stood.
Thru the cooperatuon of the various civic, federal authorities
and the property owner this play area stands, accessible for sale
by the owner,and absent of the fire and health hazards that were
present before. Buildings in the background are on E. 27th Street;
Third avenue being on the rigght and not seen.
1938
8ift of Committee on Housing
Charity Organisation Society
CREDIT LINE 1MPENAIVE
In 1DDecember of 1939, a modern six story apartment house
is being constructed on tnis site.
